project.teaser: The Sustainable Careers for Researcher Empowerment (SECURE) project will develop coordination and support measures to create, trial, implement, and mainstream a common Research Career Framework (RCF) that offers a suite of options to support organisations in the recruitment...
project.objective: The Sustainable Careers for Researcher Empowerment (SECURE) project will develop coordination and support measures to create, trial, implement, and mainstream a common Research Career Framework (RCF) that offers a suite of options to support organisations in the recruitment, employment, training, development, progression, and mobility of researchers with the aim of improving research careers and reducing career precarity. The RCF will recognise the research profession across sectors, provide a career development and progression structure for research careers, recognise both research and transferable skills and competences, facilitate intersectoral collaboration and mobility, and offer solutions to the precariousness of research careers in academia. SECURE will test aspects of the RCF and TTL models in trials in four RPOs, one RFO, and one recruitment agency . The trial organisations will first conduct a scoping exercise to map the RCF onto their existing policies and activities for research careers before developing integration plans on how the RCF could be adopted into their existing policies and activities. Due to the short duration of the project and window for trials, it is expected that only some aspects of the RCF and TTL models will be tested. The trial organisations will thus develop actions plans, selecting relevant aspects from the integration plans, to test and implement during the trials. SECURE will mainstream the RCF and TTL models through a series of policy briefs and a summit that explain key aspects of the RCF and TTL models to relevant organisations employing researchers. The RCF and TTL models will be further promoted through key partner organisations in the project targeting researchers, RPOs, and companies. The RCF and TTL models will lastly be promoted in the EURAXESS network including the many EURAXESS service centres, the newly established EURAXESS hubs, and through the ERA Talent Platform being developed.
project.title: Sustainable Careers for Researcher Empowerment
project.keywords: researcher career development framework tenure-track progression precarity

article.title: New ways to reduce the precarity of research careers

result.title: Report on Summit and Policy Roundtable Promoting SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: Report on SECURE Research Career Framework Summit at the end of the project to build awareness and promote the uptake of the RCF to the stakeholder community as well as allow discussion and interaction with the project on the RCF. The high-level summit will present the main outcomes of the project and focus on the RCF, mainstreaming plan, and policy briefs as well as lessons learned in the implementation of the RCF during the trials

result.title: Action Plans to Implement SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: Scoping exercises at the trial organisations to map the draft RCF onto their existing researcher career activities and then develop integration plans on how to adopt the components of the RCF into their researcher career frameworks. The trial organisations will then develop action plans by selecting components from the integration plans to trial at their organisations and proposing how to monitor the success of the action plans and the RCF

result.title: SECURE Deliverable 7.1: Dissemination and Communication Plan

details.authors: Šujdović, Irena; Laušević, Petar; Suchanova, Maria

result.title: SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: The final version of the RCF will offer organisations a comprehensive policy framework, legal and financial advice, and recommendations to ensure attractive research careers that attract, foster, retain, and transition research talents in Europe

result.title: Literature Search from SECURE Deliverable 1.2: STATE-OF-THE-ART on Tenure Track-Like Models

details.authors: Day, Emma; Gadbled, Robin; Halušková, Katarína; Karalija, Erna; Lebhardt, Fleur; Vega Rubio, Raquel

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Data Management Plan (DMP) which will cover data management methodology including project wide database, data standards, verification and reuse strategy, curation, preservation using the HORIZON EUROPE online manual. The DMP will be updated over the course of the project whenever significant changes arise

result.title: Policy Briefs Promoting SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: Series of policy briefs to build awareness and promote the uptake of the RCF generally as well as specifically focusing on key aspects of the RCF to the stakeholder community. The policy briefs will focus on the TTL models, deployment of ESCO and the Competence Framework for Researchers, transferable skills training and intersectoral mobility, and the strengthening of gender equality and Open Science in research careers

result.title: First Draft of SECURE Tenure Track-Like Models
result.description: First draft of the TTL models based on the literature reviews from WP1 and key existing policies and recommendations on TTL models. This will include selecting a range of best practices covering different TTL models and conducting in-depth interviews with selected candidates focusing on the legal, financial, and administrative implementation of these TTL models as well as the challenges faced and lessons learned

result.title: First Draft of SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: First draft of the RCF based on the literature reviews from WP1 and key existing policies and recommendations aimed at improving research careers and reducing precarity. This will include the integration of key policies and recommendations in the new Council Recommendations on Research Careers and the revised Charter and Code, how organisations can utilise the update to ESCO and the Competence Framework for Researchers, and other relevant legal and financial recommendations

result.title: SECURE Deliverable 7.3: Final Dissemination, Communication and Exploitation Report

details.authors: Šujdović, Irena; Anđelković, Jovana; Đorđević, Bogdan

result.title: Exploitation Plan
result.description: Exploitation plan which will utilise project results for societal and scientific purposes by concretising the value and impact of the SECURE framework. The Exploitation plan will be updated over the course of the project whenever significant changes arise

result.title: Mainstreaming Plan for SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: Mainstreaming plan to promote and drive uptake of the RCF by organisations employing researchers

result.title: Initial Policy Briefs for feedback for EC
result.description: Initial policy briefs synthesising first lessons learned from SECURE

result.title: Report on Consultation on SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: Consultation on the draft RCF with key stakeholders including research-performing and research-funding organisations, recruitment agencies, companies, and researchers. The draft RCF will be shared with the stakeholder community via an open consultation involving surveys and interactive feedback sessions with invited stakeholders. The aim of the consultation is to ensure co-design and validation of the RCF by the community as well as to drive interest and future uptake of the RCF

result.title: SECURE Deliverable 2.2: Report on Consultation on SECURE Research Career Framework

details.authors: Šujdović, Irena; Dalton, Gordon; Laušević, Petar

result.title: Report on Trials to Implement SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: Implement the action plans from T4.1 at each of the trial organisations and monitor the progress of the trials. The success of the trials will be evaluated according to the monitoring criteria proposed in the action plans and the lessons learned from the trials will be reported and will feed back into the finalisation of the RCF and TTL models in WP2 and WP3. The trial organisations will meet regularly along with key partners for mutual learning and support in the trials

result.title: Report on Consultation on SECURE Tenure Track-Like Models
result.description: Consultation on the draft TTL models with key stakeholders including research-performing and research-funding organisations, recruitment agencies, companies, and researchers. The draft TTL models will be shared with the stakeholder community via an open consultation involving surveys and interactive feedback sessions with invited stakeholders. The consultation will ensure co-design and validation of the TTL models by the community as well as drive interest and future uptake of the TTL models

result.title: SECURE Deliverable 1.2: STATE-OF-THE-ART on Tenure Track-Like Models

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: Dissemination and Communication plan, including a comprehensive communication strategy, including objectives of communication, which will raise the awareness of the project and disseminate project goals, progress, and final results to target stakeholders who can directly benefit from the project (RPO, RFO, Industry, NGO, Policy, Civil Society). D&C activities are carried out throughout the duration of the project. The D&C plan will be updated over the course of the project whenever significant changes arise

result.description: State-of-the-art on existing literature and recommendations focusing on recruitment and working conditions for researchers, career development and progression for researchers, and interinstitutional, intersectoral, and interdisciplinary mobility

result.title: Risk Management Plan
result.description: Risk Management Plan (RMP) to cover all risks including Operational, Financial, Business, Socio-Economic, Health & Safety and External Risks. The RMP will include the development of risk mitigation strategies and application of contingency in order to complete project and WP objectives on time and in budget. It will also include protocols if a WP leader does not deliver on time or fail to deliver a Deliverable

result.title: State-of-the-Art on Research Career Frameworks
result.description: State-of-the-art on existing literature and recommendations focusing on recruitment and working conditions for researchers, career development and progression for researchers, and interinstitutional, intersectoral, and interdisciplinary mobility

result.teaser: The SECURE project addressed a major challenge within the European Research Area (ERA): the absence of structured, sustainable, and attractive research career pathways, particularly in the academic sector, where precarious conditions and limited advancement opportunities...

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
